column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?
#Text=I would say de-fund abortion and review government spending and departments to find savings and cut taxes .
#Text=Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?
#Text=No , because the jump in property taxes has not been accompanied by an increase in services .
#Text=The downloading of social services had a very negative impact on municipal finances and they have difficulty in balancing their budgets .
#Text=Municipal taxes should not go to pay for services that are of provincial jurisdiction .
#Text=The system has been especially unfair to rural citizens whose cities were forcefully merged without their consent .
#Text=As an aside , my party favours eliminating the school portion on property taxes , as it is an unfair system .
#Text=How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?

#Text=The province should create a favourable business climate by paying off the debt and eliminating unnecessary government bodies , or merging others , which in turn would lead to lower taxes and more incentive to do business in Ontario .
#Text=What are your views on the mixed member proportional representation ( MMP ) referendum ?
#Text=I strongly support MMP as it would lead to a legislature that reflects the wishes of the people of Ontario .

#Text=One of the reasons why Ontarians do n’t get the government they want is that the First-Past-the-Post system provides an incentive to vote for or against the perceived front-runner , but essentially penalizes voting for a smaller party because it gives the impression of wasting one ’s vote if the candidate does not win .
#Text=MMP allows people greater choice in that sense — you do not have to vote for the first- or second-place party for your vote to count .
#Text=What role , if any , does “ new media ” play in your campaign , and the campaign of your party ?
#Text=( websites , blogs , Facebook , YouTube videos , etc )
#Text=Do you view it as beneficial , or a challenge ?
#Text=Given the fact that I work for a small party , it ’s very beneficial .
#Text=Voters can now have easier access to our candidates and we , as a party , can create more visibility .
#Text=I operate SoConBlogs.com , which is an aggregator of blogs that support the Family Coalition Party .
#Text=This has helped raise the party ’s presence , especially in the blogosphere , where many politically savvy people get their information and exchange views .
#Text=Facebook has also been very useful in helping me find supporters and people willing to help out with the party .
#Text=Of the decisions made by Ontario 's 38th Legislative Assembly , which was the most beneficial to your this electoral district ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?
#Text=Which was least beneficial , or even harmful , to your this riding ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?
